LSA model

In first place this model should not be so different from the actual one, in fact the idea behind this extension to the semantic domain, is letting to the user the decision of what type of space adopt (through OSGi bundles selection) and, consequently, what capabilities are needed. That's why the model that will result at the end of this section should be transparent to semantic, while providing all the information needed by a semantic platform to work.

Supporting Semantic Properties

A property, in the semantic domain, is identified by an URI which states a relation between a subject (another URI) and an object (an URI or Literal).

Moving to SAPERE model, an LSA should be serialized in such a way that:

  • The LSA-id becomes a subject
  • Each LSA's property becomes a property whose subject is the LSA-id and whose object is its value

In order to promote semantic framework some requirements pop up:

  1. The LSA-id should be globally unique (in the ecosystem)
  2. Each property should be associated to a specific semantic in order to be globally understood

Requirement #2 provides the foundation on which semantic reasoning can be built. In fact, with reference to the following extract, when an agent asserts that " lsa1432.age := (20) " the definition of what is the concept of age is mandatory, otherwise another agent could misunderstand the information. 

lsa1432{
	#location := ("room131"), #time := (1011233120),
	type := (person), age := (20), interests := (music,sport,travels)
}

Another subtle, but relevant, aspect is that age is not an URI, so it cannot be serialized in an RDF Store.

In conclusion a mapping between logical and physical property name should be stated in order to provide a correct serialization. This way each time a SAPERE property is called the corresponding semantic is attached by prefixing its URI. If no mapping is proposed then a fake URI should preponed in order to ensure syntax validation but avoiding any semantic inference; this property will have a meaning only in local scope and any other agent will interpret it as pure syntax.

About Requirement #1 an idea could be definining an URI which identifies each node. Inside the node each LSA-id will be defined by <node-uri>#lsa<num>, where the number is a local counter, incremented each time a new LSA is created.
